channel.title: Portland BitDevs
channel.description: Portland BitDevs is a community in the Portland, Oregon area for those interested in discussing and participating in the research and development of Bitcoin and related protocols and software.

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #34
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!

Guess the Nonce is Back

  • After some OPs engineering we can now host a raffle without getting rugged! Prizes this week ... üéâ üéÅ üòä

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for Aug 26 2025 ?
  • Artist / Graphic designed to help with branding and web applications
  • Our own Portland.BitDevs website is now online: https://portlandbitdevs.org/

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 8:30pm: Primary topics discussion.
  • 8:00pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonights topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

TODO

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #33
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!

Guess the Nonce is Back

After some OPs engineering we can now host a raffle without getting rugged! Prizes this week ... üéâ üéÅ üòä

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for Aug 26 2025
  • Artist / Graphic designed to help with branding and web applications
  • Revitalize the effort to create our own Portland.BitDevs website

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 8:30pm: Primary topics discussion.
  • 8:00pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonights topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Frostsnap Hardware Wallet
    • Sharmir Share Backup
    • Restor Wallet With M/N
    • Based on BDK
    • Early Access (Frostsnap Frontier)
  • Gemini Exchange Adds Taproot Support
  • Bitcoin Core Diskfilling Logs Attack Mitigation
    • 1MB per source maximum
    • After that truncates with ...
  • Cluster Mempool Reorg Support
    • A bunch of Transctions could be reorged back into the mempool cuasing too large of a cluster
    • Now accounts for this
    • Removes as a DoS vector
  • Descriptor Encoding Compression
    • Uses bech32 to reduce the number of Bits needed to represent a descritpor when transmitting thorough a QR Code
  • Taproot Control Block Data Store?
    • Using the merkle pairs it's possible to encode a payload into the taproot control block
  • Sub 1 sat/vBtye Summer is here
    • Over 50% of hashrate is now mining sub 1 sat/vByte transactions
  • Mempool.space displays sub 1 sat/vByte Txns
    • Baha Blast Green Color
    • Official Post
  • CoinDCX Indian Exchange Hacked 44MM

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #32
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

The Portland Bitcoin Group Meetup is now sponsored by the non-profit Bitcoin is for Everyone! Insider Tickets (shhh!) available for a limited time

  • Ticket-only ($99)üéü

  • Combo: ticket plus T-shirt ($124)üéüüëï

Bitcoin is for Everyone Friday Aug 1st 2025 Revolution Hall

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for July 22. 2025
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications. [1.7 years in]
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience.

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 8:30pm: General Bitcoin Developer Discussion Lead by PortlandHODL and Eric.
  • 8:30pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Privatizing Bitcoin Core
    • There are no additional explicit obligations beyond the license.
    • Githubs poor moderation tools
    • Use Gitlab (Private access for pulls/issues)
    • A lot of development and discussion alreayd happening in private (Chaincode, Brink, etc..)
    • Reduce interaction from non-technical activist users
  • DoS Inventory
  • Censorship Resistant
  • Whirlpools are back!
  • Ledger Recovery Key
    • SE uses pin to access secret.
    • Ledger Flex or Stax can use used to decode and display the secret
      • Still closed source so what is the point?
    • Licence issues
  • BitVM Garbeled Circuits
    • Current BitVM Transactions can be very large. (non-standard)
    • Avoids this
  • Bitlayer Partners with 45% hash
    • Get NST mined into the chain
    • Goal is large TXs presumably (unless the above takes foot)
  • 1 sat/vByte Summer is here
    • MARA (Policy of .1 Sats/vByte)
    • F2Pool (Policy of .1 Sats/vByte)
    • Ant pool (Sometimes mining .1 Sats/vByte)
    • Discussion about how to make this happen + wallet Support
      • Tx Pidgeon
      • net.h
      • maxconnections=125
      • Mononaut
  • Knots Banlist
    • Twitter
    • Github
    • Lopp Active filter
  • Stark Based Mining
    • Plausible deniability
    • SV2 Implementation
  • Selfish Mining
    • Simulator
  • Ephemeral Dust Hitting the Mempool
  • OP_RETURN Uncapped as Policy (core)
    • Reasoning
  • Non-confiscatory Transaction Weight Limit
  • Age based expiration of UTXOs
    • IMO a horrible idea, none the less presented
  • Timechain Arcade

Interesting

  • Bitcoin Policy Summit (Whashington Getting in Bed with Crypto)
  • Bitcoin Shooter - No More Inflation
  • Hackers Torch 90 Million in BTC for Motive
    • Quantum Proof Address 1FuckiRGCTerroristsNoBiTEX
    • Akin to a military strike
  • Zeus Video Tutorial

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #31
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

The Portland Bitcoin Group Meetup is now sponsored by the non-profit Bitcoin is for Everyone! Insider Tickets (shhh!) available for a limited time

  • Ticket-only ($99)üéü

  • Combo: ticket plus T-shirt ($124)üéüüëï

Bitcoin is for Everyone Friday Aug 1st 2025 Revolution Hall

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!
  • Thank you to Jon for the Bank Simulator Presentation.

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for June 17. 2025
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications. [1.7 years in]
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience!

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.L
  • 7:00pm - 8:30pm: General Bitcoin Developer Discussion Lead by PortlandHODL and Eric.
  • 8:30pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Bitcoin Mining Centralization Report 0xB10C
  • 'Art' Block Pizza Day
    • Escrow transaction
    • Using node connect to protect funds
    • Reorg risk mitigation using non-standard txns
  • Legacy Wallet Support Removed for v30.0
  • RPC User/Password has been undeprecated
  • Miniscript n/n bug
  • Garbage Man Client Eclipsing
    • Response
  • TX Pidgeon using inventory messages
  • Optimiziing Cluster Mempool
  • BitKey Open Sources their Codebase
  • Core Sub 29.0 Vuln
  • Timelock Cleanup for GCC, Cores Internal Miner
  • Hard Forking Bitcoin
    • PR Removing Checkpoints
  • BTCPay Server Broken
    • Post
  • Skibidi Wallet Challenge
  • Orange Surf UTXO Set Report
  • Large OP_RETURNs hit the chain
  • MARA Enabled Taproot Annex Support (Unstructured)
  • Mempool.space enabled SigHash Flag Visualization
  • OP_RETURNS Nonstandard getting mined
    • Most were using OP_RETURN BOT
    • Nonstandard transaction usage increasing.

Interesting

  • Transaction Propigation Time

Bitcoin News

  • Gemini Credit Card. BlockFi V2?
  • Fake ledger steals coins
  • Ledger False Advertising
  • Lumis Refuses to meet with Ripple CEO
  • Bitcoin Hits 3Billion spend txos
  • Square will accept bitcoin payments to all PoS
    • Not using sats
  • Steak and Shake LN payments
  • Strategy Completely Dogdges PoR question
  • Zeus onchain Swaps + Ecash

Tech News

Google Veo3 - Boomers Hell

  • Bitcoin Core PR Checker
  • Taproot Tree Visualizer on Mempool.space
  • Ancient Inscriptions

  • Polymarket Adds OP_CAT vs. OP_CTV
  • XRP NPM Package PWND'
  • üö® Breaking Bitcoin Slides üö®
  • GCC - SPV Proofs Vulnerable to 64 Byte TXNS
  • PSBT V2. Viewer
  • Testnet3 Removal?
  • Taproot Annex Relay

Interesting

  • Transaction Propigation Time
  • bitcoindata.space
    • WIP Torrents for Bitcoin Timechain Data

Bitcoin News

  • [ETH/BTC] ATL

Tech News

  • Very nice video about LLVM ‚ù§Ô∏è Rust
  • Microsoft Quantum Meta Materials

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #28
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

The Portland Bitcoin Group Meetup is now sponsored by the non-profit Bitcoin is for Everyone! Insider Tickets (shhh!) available for a limited time

  • Ticket-only ($99)üéü

  • Combo: ticket plus T-shirt ($124)üéüüëï

Bitcoin is for Everyone Friday Aug 1st 2025 Revolution Hall

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!
  • Thank you to Jon for the Bank Simulator Presentation.

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for March. 25 2025
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications. [1.5 years in]
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience.

Guess the Nonce

  • 1x The Fiat Standard
  • 1x PDX Bitdevs Waterbottle

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 7:20pm: Jon Bank Simulator Presentation
  • 7:20pm - 8:30pm: General Bitcoin Developer Discussion Lead by PortlandHODL and Eric
  • 8:30pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Braiins bASIC
  • Mempool.space Stratum Viewer
  • OFAC Transactions Missing From Blocks
  • Package Relay Cipher Challenge
    • Spending Transaction
  • Mempool Clears (Multiple Times)
  • Funds Sent to Satoshis P2PK Script
  • The Bitcoin Kernel
    • Modular Consensus Plugin.
    • Deprecates lib-bitcoinconsensus
    • Code Cleanliness
    • Parts have been merged but not completely
  • kernel: Move kernel-related cache constants to kernel cache
  • Bitcoin Script Simplicty vs. Eth.
  • V3 Lightning Channel Closes
    • Completely removes fees from the the closing transaction removing a massive part of the attack surface that enables the theft of funds.
  • Bolts Include BIP353 Name in Invoice
    • BIP 353
  • Covenants Alignment Chart
  • Large TXs and Block Construction
    • Knapsack Probelm
  • Orange Pill App LN Wallet
  • Improved Bitcoin Seed Tool by Ian Colemann
  • Bitcoin Reorg Calculator

Bitcoin News

  • Gox Hack 21st Anniversary
  • SBF Tweets from Jail?
  • LN Pizza Day (Eric)
  • Arb data in Emojis

Tech News

  • LLVM Meeting Notes Public
    • Learn a lot more about what make LLVM tick under the hood and what is next
    • Very nice video about LLVM ‚ù§Ô∏è Rust
  • Falppy Coin
    • Made purely using Grok
  • Claude 3.7
    • Much better frontend dev
    • Marginally better backend dev
  • Microsoft Quantum Meta Materials
  • Bitcoin++ Winners + entries
  • ByBit Hacked for 1.5B in 'Crypto'
  • This is why we Bitcoin

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #27
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!
  • Happy First BitDevs of 2025
  • Want to extend a warm welcome to our special host 'J'
    • Host of the first NY BitDevs

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for Feb. 25 2025
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications. [1.5 years in]
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience.

Guess the Nonce

  • TOP SECRET GIFTS Provided by Eric!

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 7:20pm: Portland.HODL Presentation TRUC üöö.
  • 7:20pm - 8:30pm: General Bitcoin Developer Discussion Lead By 'J'
  • 8:30pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Wassabi Privacy Vuln.
    • 3 different wallets affected.
    • Coordinator can enter the join as many times as they would like.
  • Mempool Contents (State) Then vs Now
  • Foundry¬≤
  • The Bitcoin Kernel
    • Modular Consensus Plugin.
    • Deprecates lib-bitcoinconsensus
    • Code Cleanliness
    • Parts have been merged but not completely
  • kernel: Move kernel-related cache constants to kernel cache
  • p2p: Fill reconciliation sets (Erlay) attempt 2
  • p2p: track and use all potential peers for orphan resolution
  • Cluster Mempool
  • LN Losing money to fees
  • Coinswap 0.1.0 Released
    • Full Coinswap protocol has been formalized.
  • Bolts Include BIP353 Name in Invoice
    • BIP 353
  • Support Trampoline flag in BOLT12 invoices
  • Art Blocks on Mempool.space
    • Trump
    • BTCAI
  • Foundation Prime PSP
    • Shitcoin Support (XMT, Extensions)
    • Not a wallet?
    • Own Rust based OS.
    • Separate Bluetooth Chipset.
  • Anchor Outputs Swpet on Mainnet
  • Covenants Alignment Chart
  • Large TXs and Block Construction

Bitcoin News

  • Bitcoin Core Dev Tech Transacripts
  • NVK Block Clock Takedown

Tech News

  • LLVM Meeting Notes Public
    • Learn a lot more about what make LLVM tick under the hood and what is next
    • Very nice video about LLVM ‚ù§Ô∏è Rust

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #26
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for October 22 2024
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications.
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience.

Guess the Nonce

  • Bitcoin t-shirt (Large)
  • The Fiat Standard (hardcover)
  • Set of 4 Bitcoin / Pleb Miner coasters

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 7:30pm: CrazyK Presenation "Free Samourai".
  • 7:30pm - 8:00pm: Portland.HODL Presentation - "Bitcoin Bitcoin ‚ù§Ô∏è Rust"
  • 8:00pm - 8:30pm: General Bitcoin Developer Discussion
  • 8:30pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • VSCode Bitcoin Script Hints
    • Allows you to use the Bitcoin Script Rust Crate with Stack based hints
    • Emulates to a small degree scriptwiz
  • Ascisco - Bitcoin Mining Types
  • John Carvhalo - Sats = Bitcoin BIP
    • Actual repo
  • Foundation Prime PSP
    • Shitcoin Support (XMT, Extensions)
    • Not a wallet?
    • Own Rust based OS.
    • Separate Bluetooth Chipset.
  • Zero Fee Playgound - Super Testnet
    • Testnet4 Example
  • Anchor Outputs Swpet on Mainnet
  • Covenants Alignment Chart
  • Large TXs and Block Construction

Bitcoin News

  • Mempal v1.4.0 Released
    • New app icon.
    • Major optimizations.
    • Save multiple custom mempool servers.
    • Set notification intervals from minutes to seconds.
    • Tap to refresh any individual dashboard card.
  • Wasabi - Privacy Vuln.
  • Bitcoin Core Dev Tech Transacripts
  • NVK Block Clock Takedown

Tech News

  • BADRam Attack
    • Spoofs double size RAM so that when the user writes a single known bit the other bit can be discovered.
  • LLVM Meeting Notes Public
    • Learn a lot more about what make LLVM tick under the hood and what is next
    • Very nice video about LLVM ‚ù§Ô∏è Rust

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #25
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!
  • √¶on for the presentation about MemPal!

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for December 24 2024
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications.
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience.

Guess the Nonce

  • T-Shirt
  • The Fiat Standard - Saif

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 7:30pm: Guest Speaker: √¶on
  • 7:30pm - 8:30pm: Primary topics discussion.
  • 8:00pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Bitcoin Core Disables Full RBF
  • Colliderscript
    • Covenants without OP_CODES
    • Uses SHA1 Verification
  • Testnet 4 Unminable
    • Software miners exploiting deficulty adjustments (20 minute rule)
    • Drops difficulty to 1
    • ASIC mining software cant handle this rule so they still mine at regular difficulty
  • Bitcoin Script Stack Viewer NVim
    • Using Rust Bitcoin Lib with NVim you can view the stack elements as you code
  • Bitcoin Core < v25.0 DoS inv-to-send sets
    • 0xB10C Graphs and Analysis
  • Cluster Mempool Overview By @murchandamus
  • Metaprotocol Runes Fee Round Trip Mempool View
  • Ocean Datum Released
    • Github
    • Tutorial
    • My thoughs about using and modifying Datum
  • Ocean Hits 4EH/s
  • Atowns Signet Usage Report
  • Sparrow Wallet 2.0 Released
  • libsecp256k1 v0.6.0 Released
  • Gloria Zhao - TABConf TRUC TX modified in flight

Bitcoin News

  • 0xB10C Mining Pool Game Theory During Forks
  • Sparrow 2.0 Released
  • Microstratgey Buys 5.4B USD of Bitcoin
  • Portland.HODL OP_NEXT Talk about Bitcoin Soft Forks
  • BCAP - Analyzing Bitcoin Consensus
  • US Court of Appeals Rules Tornado Cash Sanctions Unconstitutional

Tech News

  • Rust Bitcoin Course Now Free
  • Bitcoin Miner Shutting Down Results in 20% Higher Electricity Costs
  • Starkware OP_CAT Bounty
  • CoinKite Black Friday
  • Bitkey $99

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #24
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for October 22 2024
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications.
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience.

Guess the Nonce

  • T-Shirt
  • Bitcoin Coffee
  • Pack of Pleb Cards
  • Pack of Pleb Cards

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 7:30pm: Guest Speaker: Jestopher - BancoLibre Demo
  • 7:30pm - 8:30pm: Primary topics discussion.
  • 8:00pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Bolt12 Added to Bolts Repo
  • Testnet 4 Consensus Failure
    • Timewarp mitigation strategy to reduce block forward time from 3200s to 600s.
    • Forked Testnet4.
    • Alerted by NickH from Luxor something was wrong.
    • Added MARA hash an resolved the fork.
  • Mining Pool Similarities
  • Floresta v0.6.0
    • Expose some unexposed values for jsonrpc: Lets the user select between getting a serialized block or a json
    • Bring our functional tests to life: attempts to build some basis for the Python-based tests
    • Async add new address to electrum: Now, if you subscribe to an address that we don't follow yet, we'll start following it
    • Implement tagged hashes for the leafhashes: This futures-proof the leaf commitment scheme from future modifications of the committed data, and it's now part of the utreexo protocol
    • Connect cli option: This option lets you connect exclusively to one specific node, given its IP address
    • Rework internal node structure: Use our actors model to build optmized nodes for each phase of the startup process
    • Add AssumeValidArg enum and correct verify_script: This adds a new AssumeValidArg to make communicating the desired assume-valid more ergonomic
    • Add batch request for electrum: Now electrum lets users perform multiple requests at once, rather than sending one at the time
    • Add PoW fraud proof: Implement pow fraud proofs for our node and enable it on signet for testing
    • Log to file: Now you can write the logs to a file
    • Add lib.rs: florestad is also a lib now, it can be used on other applications and
    • Download and store filters from the network: Now we can download BIP-158 Compact Block Filters and use them to recover historical transactions without downloading the whole blockchain.
    • Cache headers on ibd: Hold headers in memory and save all-at-once, because the database can optimize some writing operations
    • electrum: new experimental electrum endpoints: This adds some experimental (and not used by any wallet) endpoints to the electrum server blockchain.scriptpubkey
    • Nixify: Add a nix-based build system and some developer tools to floresta
  • ARC Transaction Performed on Bitcoin Mainnet -Spec
  • Bitcoin Core < 24.0.1 DoS

Bitcoin News

  • Strike adds BOLT12 support
    • Bolt12 is overall a 'Better' solution to static payment addresses in lightning
    • No need to setup and maintain a webserver
  • Fractal Bitcoin - 13EX/s from Bitcoin Mainnet
    • Shitcoin disguised as L2 uses SHA256D
    • Not merged mined has absorbed 15EX/s
    • Downward Difficulty
  • Transactions Lower than 2 sats/vByte were clearing
  • Merge Mining becoming less popular | STATS
  • Calculating your Solo Mining Odds
  • 0xB10C Mining Pool Game Theory During Forks
  • Blue Wallet v7.0 [1,2] Released
    • Added total balance to the overview screen
    • Ability to disable phone privacy blur
    • iOS lock screen widgets
    • BIP47 Address Support - Still needs an onchain TXN for payment code.
  • Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Notes
  • Eric | SuperScalar Proposal
  • Sparrow 2.0 Released

Tech News

  • Rust Bitcoin Course Now Free
  • Hackers Leak 2.7 Billion Data Records (SSNs, Addresses)
  • Caroline Ellison of FTX gets 24 Months
  • Bitcoin Miner Shutting Down Results in 20% Higher Electricity Costs
  • Starkware OP_CAT Bounty

item.title: PDX BitDevs Socratic Seminar #23
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Announcements

Please join us for our next Socratic Seminar. A special thank you to our host Primal Burger, for the event space. Please support them by buying their delicious food or a beverage.

If you can't make it to the main event please join us at Lutz Tavern around 9PM here.

Special Thanks | Mentions

  • Thank you to everyone who shows up each month!

Rules

  • Respect people's privacy
  • Chatham House Rules
  • Interaction and asking questions are encouraged!

Requests

  • A guest speaker for September 28 2024
  • Artist / Graphic designer to help with branding and web applications.
  • Continue to improve the Portland BitDevs web experience.

Schedule

  • 6:30pm - 7:00pm: Arrive, socialize, and grab some food.
  • 7:00pm - 8:30pm: Primary topics discussion.
  • 8:00pm - 9:00pm: Overtime discussions about tonight's topics or additional user submissions.

Bitcoin Dev News

  • Intel SGX Compromised
    • Not completely comprimised but master private key and sealing key both comprimised
    • Path forward to completely comprimising the SGX
    • SGX is no longer offered in desktop class processors, only Xeons
    • Used in cloud environments to hide information
    • Currently arm Secure Enclave ramins superior
  • Testnet 4 PR Merged
    • Attempt was made to fix the 20 minute blockstoms / timewarp - here
    • Most fixes were to fix the issues with blockstroms / timewarp - here
    • Mempool.space Testnet4 Explorer link
  • 5G Base Station Exploit
    • Defcon Deauth attacks to force a 4g connection, then your phone upgrages back to the comprimised basestation.
  • AMD Sinkclose Flaw
  • Mempool v3.0.0
    • Add Mempool Accelerator‚Ñ¢ to accelerate TX from your own instance
    • Add Mempool Googles‚Ñ¢ new mempool and blockchain analytics tool
    • Add RBF Timeline visualizations including support for FullRBF
    • Add CPFP and Effective Fee calculations in block visualizations
    • Add Liquid Network audit tool to verify holdings vs liabilities
    • Add new Wallet Balance widget for embedding into external sites
    • Add customizable CSS themes including a new high-contrast mode
    • Add optional support for FreecurrencyAPI fiat currencies
    • Add optional Redis support for faster in-memory database
    • Add support for legacy P2PK addresses and outputs
    • Add new block fees graph at /graphs/mining/block-fees
    • Add new fiat calculator at /tools/calculator
    • Re-design transaction page with new mobile "pizza tracker" UI
    • Re-design address page with new balance history over time
    • Improve Block Audit for accelerated transaction out-of-band fees
    • Improve Websocket API to support tracking multiple addresses
    • Improve search box now supports searching multiple networks
    • Improve TV View to add new circular clock face view
  • 'Dark Skippy' Attack
    • Demo
    • Pollards Rho (kangaroo)
    • Visual of the power of Pollards Rho for breaking DLP
  • Slipstream OP_CAT
    • Not actually valid
    • OP_SUCCESSx BIP342
    • Makes scipts unconditionally valid as such anyone can spend.
    • Could cause forks?
    • Retroactive enforcements of rules burden devs.
    • Roles of "Dev Hooks"
    • IRC discussion with GMAXWELL IRC weblogs

Bitcoin News

  • Bitcoin Core EoL Security Disclosures
  • Mempool.space Block Time Analysis
  • Smaller Pools seemingly keep better precision han the larger pools.
  • BitAxe wins a block | I was wrong but still right
  • 0xB10C Mining Pool Game Theory During Forks
  • Blue Wallet v7.0 [1,2] Released
    • Added total balance to the overview screen
    • Ability to disable phone privacy blur
    • iOS lock screen widgets
    • BIP47 Address Support - Still needs an onchain TXN for payment code.
  • Bisq 2.1.0 Released
    • Support Lightning Network as a settlement method.
    • Better visualizations
  • Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Notes
  • A better timewarp attack
  • Coldcard PushTX
    • MTP visualizations Ex. Script

Tech News

  • Hackers Leak 2.7 Billion Data Records (SSNs, Addresses)
  • Telegram Founder Arrested - France
  • Jullian Assange Ends Legal Fight

Figures

Timestamp vs MTP - Mainnet

Timestamp Vs MTP - Tesntnet

  • LNHANCE
    • OP_CHECKTEMPLATE_VERIFY
    • OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
    • OP_INTERNALKEY
  • 27877
    • Coin grinder selection algorithm will
      • Optimizes to reduce fees in the current TX
      • Assumes fees network fees will go down so the next TX could/will be larger
      • Does this by minimizing inputs.
  • Marathon Slipstream
    • This article sucks but still shows the general sentiment
    • Direct Submissions of TXs
    • Private mempool
  • Bitcoin-dev Mailing List Migration
    • New location
  • Rijndael OP_CAT Covenants
    • Uses Liquid
    • Andrew Poelstra Thesis
    • No need for OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK

  • Zeus 0.8 Released
    • OLYMPUS by ZEUS 0-conf channel service
    • Zaplocker self-custodial lightning addresses
    • Taproot Channel Support
  • OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY regains community support
    • Twitter Post Supporting Covenants
    • Mailing List - Scaling Lightning with Simple Covenantsi

  • Programming Bitcoin Part 2. Elliptic Curves

Tech news

  • P2MS (PERMIT_BAREMULTISIG) discussion resurfaces as stamps usage increases
    • Stamps bloat the UTXO set serialized size through data storage
    • This is a relay policy change, as such doesn't change consensus
    • Has positives and negatives
  • Ledger Unsupisingly Harversting User Data
  • Ocean enables 3 termplates for miners to choose from
    • 'OCEAN Recommended' - Claims to be the best fliter for removing arbitrary data.
    • 'Ordistrspector' - Looser policy the culls inscription based scripts[]
    • Bitcoin Core '- The regular Bitcoin Core block template generation (Takes a pool fee of 2%)
  • Payjoin Client for Bitcoin Core released
    • Enables a coinjoin between 2 people that appears to be a single spend onchain
  • Zeus 0.8 Released
    • OLYMPUS by ZEUS 0-conf channel service
    • Zaplocker self-custodial lightning addresses
    • Taproot Channel Support
  • BTCPay Server Comprimised
    • Twitter Posti
    • Large Theft
  • OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY regains community support
    • Twitter Post Supporting Covenants
    • Mailing List - Scaling Lightning with Simple Covenants
  • .4BTC Taken from ColdCard - User Error

Market News

  • Barry Silbert Resigns from Grayscale
    • Resignation
    • Fraud Allegations
